subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
The European Projects Association–EPA is a politically independent nonprofit organization active in Brussels since 2008 to connect and empower European professionals and researchers whose aim is to contribute to a better and more meaningful development of Europe.   
“What are you doing…for a better society?” is the title of EPA leading Campaign and EPA’s guiding principle. The Campaign, now at its forth edition, aims to encourage a growing participation of the European civil society, by rewarding the initiatives most innovative and beneficial for the development of European regions. It aims at raising awareness on the value of every individual in the building  of a better society and strengthening EU democratic legitimacy. 
EPA operates to increase the effects of EU policies through a better use of the Union funding instruments, providing to its members all information, networking, services and tools to participating in the best possible way to EU funding system. 
 
EPA acts through: 
 
4  Multidisciplinary Councils                                                                  Regional and Local Council; Business and Economy Council; Academic and Research Council; Associations and Networks Council  
 
2 Transversal Committees                                                 South East Europe Committee; Information and Technology Committee  
  
5 Territorial Contact Points active in 2013                                   Belgium, Brussels Capital, Finnovaregio Foundation;  Croatia, Region of Istria, Informo Association; Italy, Region of Lazio, Ken Parker Sistemi; Slovenia, Novo Mesto, University of Novo Mesto; United Kingdom, Caephilly, EU Reconnect
